bibl.title: William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham v. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit, Territory of Washington

body.p: In the Justice Court before John T. Mason one of the Justices of the Peace and and for Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit Territory of Washington
Territory of Washington }ss Plaintiff vs David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell Defendants

On this the 31st day august AD 1887 William W. Tinkham and on oath complains and says that on the 28th day of august 1887 that he the said William W. Tinkham and Annie L. Tinkham being then and there peacefully within said County and Territory certain persons to wit David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell did then and there and in a angry manner and threatening manner and being armed with a double barreled shot gun carried in the hands of David E. Kimble did threaten to do great bodily injury to the said William W. Tinkham and Annie L. Tinkham to wit to strike fear and kill the said Wililam W. Tinkham and Annie L. Tinkham for witch a warrant was issued and placed in the hands of John Lorensey Constable for Service on the said David E Kimble and A.B. Corriell
Warrant returned served on the 1st day of September AD 1887

and the said defendants to wit David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell being under arrest and brought into court and after hearing the complaint plead not guilty as charged in the complaint and the times first for hearing the said cause at two oclock PM on the 2nd day of September and subpoenas issued for witnesses on behalf of the defendants

Friday Sept 2nd 1887 two oclock PM court called to order present prosecuting witnesses and defendants with there respective council William W. Tinkham and Annie L. Tinkham come on the part of the prosecution and as prosecting witnesses

And defendants now move to dismiss the action and discharge the defendants on the grounds that from the evidence it dose not appear that there is just cause to face the commission of any offense by the parties complaint of and against the said William W. Tinkham and Annie L. Tinkham motion sustained and Defendants ordered discharged from custody

and it appearing to the court that said complaint was unfounded and it is ordered adjudged and directed that William W Tinkham the prosecuting witness pay the costs of this action. Taxed of forty $40 25/100 dollars and that execution issue there for and that the said prosecuting witness stand committed until said judgement is satisfied or he be discharged and that a issue for the same
John T. Mason Justice of the Peace
Justice fees Complaint 50 Warrant 1.00 12 subpoenas 1.35 Judgement 50 2 oaths 20 filing 2 habeas 30 Taxing costs 50 4.35
Constable fees Serving warrant and mileage 2.30 serving subpoena 9.40 costs $11.70 27.50 witness fees $9.20

A Hartson 2.00 L.A Ford 2.00 M Blogit 2.20 E.G. English 2.00 Mr. OCleary 2.00 Mrs. OCleary 2.00 William Gage 2.00 Mrs M Kimble 2.00 Ida Kimble 2.00 Mrs Mobertone 2.00 Mr Barrington 2.00 Mrs Barrington 2.00 $24.20
I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true and correct copy of all the entries made in my docket in the said action
John T. Mason Justice of the Peace
